text: BACK TO POLICIES helps to create better places for all. Part 2 requires that constructive engagement and co-production with the community should begin at the earliest possible stage and the community should have an input into what is provided on a site rather than simply being asked to respond to pre-prepared proposals. The final design of a site must be grounded in an understanding of the community, and this means that particular consideration should be given to hearing the voices of women, girls, disabled people, the LGBTQ+ community, and ethnic minorities in the design of proposals, to ensure their views are considered.
